item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Hope and Glory
item.description: "There's a lesson for life for you: never give up the punt for the pole." -- Hope and Glory

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Robert Westall
item.description: "He smelt of English sweat and English beer, and it was a good cure for dead faces." -- Robert Westall

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Sebastian Barry
item.description: "A Ford motorcar is a magical thing in the night with the spraying lamps against the pitch road and the smell of metal and perfume under the clothy roof." -- Sebastian Barry

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "...The verses of Byron, Keats or Poe are real whether they are in bootleg form or not. You can still read them for the same effect." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by John Knowles
item.description: "There was no harm in taking aim, even if the target was a dream." -- John Knowles

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I could look at stationers' shops forever and ever." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I don't want to miss <i>anything.</i>" -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth E. Wein
item.description: "I felt like one who wants to trap and cage a little bird, and after years of waiting and luring and baiting finds that she must do no more than hold out her hand, and the finch lands on her finger and does not fly. You scarcely dare to move. It rests on your hand whole and free, foolishly trusting and infinitely courageous. It will never be more beautiful." -- Elizabeth E. Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "The gift that isn't big enough to make a mark, but is too big to leave the possessor in peace. And so they can't be content to be Sunday painters, or poets who write for a few friends, or composers whose handful of delicate little settings of Emily Dickinson can't find a singer. It's a special sort of hell." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Kate Lord Brown
item.description: "You'd think they would train these SOE girls better, it's just sloppy.' Hans sipped his cognac. 'She looked the wrong way crossing the road, silly girl." -- Kate Lord Brown

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "FLY THE PLANE, MADDIE." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "It's impossible to stall a Lizzie." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "My heart is warm with the friends I make, And better friends I'll not be knowing, Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take, No matter where it's going." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Eva Rice
item.description:
"One would never write a single word if one knew the horrors that lay ahead,’ agreed Charlotte.
‘But if you sell copies by the sackload, you may well forget the horrors,’ I agreed quickly." -- Eva Rice

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "I am no longer afraid of getting old. Indeed I can't believe I ever said anything so stupid. So childish. So offensive and <i>arrogant</i>. But mainly, so very, very stupid. I desperately want to grow old." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "A whore, we've established that, filthy, it goes without saying, but whatever else the hell I am, I AM NOT ENGLISH." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "He just put his hand through the bulkhead, exactly as she'd done, and squeezed my shoulder. He has very strong fingers. And he kept his hand there the whole way home, even when he was reading the map and giving me headings. So I am not flying alone now after all." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "Please come back soon. The window is always open." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "I, of course, took the opportunity to interpose with pigheaded Wallace pride, 'I am not English, you ignorant Jerry bastard, I am a SCOT." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "If you show this devious little liar one atom's worth of compassion I will have you shot." -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "<i>She has the filthiest tongue of any woman in France. Burn her mouth clean.</i>" -- Elizabeth Wein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Hilary McKay
item.description: "I used to think that fifteen would be nearly grown up," said her sister Naomi, "until you started being it" -- Hilary McKay

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Wein
item.description: "Se parece a enamorarse, saber que acabas de encontrar a tu mejor amiga." -- Elizabeth Wein
